website_summaries.verdict: With the latest firmware, the Linksys EA6500 makes a decent contender among the handful of its peers.
pros: The Linksys Smart Wi-Fi Router AC 1750 HD Video Pro EA6500 offers solid performance and lots of cloud-based features
cons: The Linksys EA6500's performance with existing pre-802.11ac clients could use some improvement, and the router is comparatively expensive

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with OpenDNS
customer_reviews.text: don't buy this if you want to setup OpenDNS. The router does NOT accept static DNS IP address. this is a known bug which they are claiming it to be a "feature". Interestingly, both companies are owned by Cisco. go figure. There also seems to be an issue with passing static IP to the ethernet side of the connection. I would not buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Kayvon Sadeghi

customer_reviews.title: Worse range than their wrt-g model. Dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy setup. Ac wireless technology. Aesthetically pleasing. Cheap (55$ deal) at the time. Cons: RANGE. IS. AWFUL. I bought this as a gift for my parents to replace their terribly outdated wrt54g. Got it up and running in minutes. Imagine my disappointment when I realized the range is noticeably worse than the nearly obsolete model I just replaced. It barely extends to the roku in their bedroom and drops signal in places They used to have steady signal. Within 20 feet it's great. Go any further than that and the signal drops off a cliff. Don't ignore the reviews like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hambleton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router!!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't have asked for a better router! I play WoW while my kids are playing Destiny on the Xbox online. Neither of us get lag or kicked off, no buffering constantly while everthing catches up. Easy to set up, easy to set up parental controls and to adjust all the names of the items I have connected. I can set the router to turn on & off certain devices at certain times, or block certain sites. I really can't say enough about this router! If you are looking for a strong router to run your devices, this is the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: Dragons1stFire

customer_reviews.title: Extremely BUGGY! Still in ALPHA STAGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always use Linksys routers and far as I can remember but this has to be the worst and most expensive router I have ever own! I must say, the "bells and whistles" really caught my attention! I bought this to replace my E1200 Linksys router (no Gigabit ports)! I don’t think that this model should have been released until fully tested. Even with the firmware updates, it was still buggy! The user interface is horrible and every change you make it takes forever to save changes! I keep getting drop signals and settings going back to default! I sent this router right back after a couple of days! I would not recommend this expensive product!
customer_reviews.author: A. George

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while and then spiraling into a turtle-death wireless trap
customer_reviews.text: This router works smoothly for a few months, but then suddenly it started requiring reboots every day when I get home from work just so I can access the Internet. I thought perhaps that some issues arose from using a beta iOS version, but I dumped that and the issues are still causing unusable low wireless speeds and intermittent connections. Rebooting the wireless does sort out the issues temporarily, but it's been a nuisance to come home to find out the wireless is turtle-slow and chugging into unusable territory. I contacted Linksys support and am awaiting some assistance, since I'm out of my Amazon return window. Frustrating, to say the least :(
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: speed good, BAD firmware and settings
customer_reviews.text: Speeds are great and never have issues. PRO Can set up both a 2.4ghs network and 5ghz with different names and passwords PRO If Linksys server is down you can edit your setting localy, you must disconect your modem/internet only has NAT only which means you cant ping or port farward servers, games , xbox live issues. if you turn NAT off you have no internet still no ping, servers , ect Tech support is a JOKE! forums everwhere saying they have a problem with this unit and are returning it. I will never by cisco or Linksys. This router is NOT supported by Cisco, you must go though linksys which is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah McQuiston

customer_reviews.title: Runs 4 iPads, 3 iPhones, a few tvs ...
customer_reviews.text: Runs 4 iPads, 3 iPhones, a few tvs, Netflix, Amazon prime, mlbtv, etc., without a glitch. I can control it from an app on my phone and shut off the internet on the kids whenever i want. (Actually I am using this feature without their knowledge. This may be passive, but it works for me.) The only glitch is that, although I can assign a block on a website, it doesn't work. For instance, if one of the kids is using the Internet, I can tell the modem to block YouTube, but it doesn't block it. I can't figure out why. So it's all or nothing when blocking the Internet on a device.
customer_reviews.author: RMA

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrible router!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for two weeks, and my network was down MOST of that time. This is a terrible router! It drops connections, locks up, and gets into a never-ending reboot cycle at least once a day. And, YES that is with the very latest firmware. Once it starts rebooting over and over, the only thing to do is a hard reset and reconfigure your network. I'm pretty darn good at setting up wired and wireless networks, and this is the absolute WORST router I've dealt with in over 10 years. What a complete joke! Avoid the EA6500 AT ALL COSTS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: get a small cord extension or anything like that since it's bulky and very bad looking
customer_reviews.text: Ignore old reviews. This just works, 3 minutes setup (including firmware upgrade) and you're done. Power cord is slim, the problem is the connector plug to the wall. It's just too big. it won't let any other devise to be plugged into the wall. Basically, get a small cord extension or anything like that since it's bulky and very bad looking. Other than that, Dual Band works just great, Gigabit ports come handy and it really impressed me at AC speed.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Strong, dependable, and easy
customer_reviews.text: Updated my old netgear router and everything is running smoothly. easy to access setting are great, speeds are wonderful and i no longer have to reset my router randomly. It comes with many features i havent used but would be nice like using the nfc card to connect nfc enabled devices or the app to remotely control my network. it has been dependable so far and its nice not to have to worry about it and just enjoying my high speed network.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works, but it is buggy
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it has a lot of problems. In order to set up parental controls, you need to pick a device from the device list. Unfortunately, devices sometimes fail to show up in the device list. One of my son's computers was in the list long enough for me to give it a DHCP reservation, but it no longer appears, so I can't adjust the parental controls. I'm trying to set up OpenDNS, but the DNS settings on it are broken with the current firmware release. The concept is nice, but this is barely beta quality software. Linksys should be embarrassed to have this as their flagship product.
customer_reviews.author: KBarbieri

customer_reviews.title: In the beginning it works pretty well but recently it drops signal frequently for both ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 8 months ago. In the beginning it works pretty well but recently it drops signal frequently for both wired and wireless. I noticed that my IP phone device connecting directly to Modem has no problem. Therefore I rebooted it and everything back to normal. But does it mean this device need to be reboot frequently? And I need to tell my family member to do so as well? A little disappointed for this product
customer_reviews.author: T. Xia

customer_reviews.title: YOU WILL HAVE A HASSLE
customer_reviews.text: DEFECTIVE. Installed on 9/17/2013 the router worked flawlessly until Thursday October 24, 2013 (7 days past 30-day return window). After extensive troubleshooting with Comcast Xfinity rep, the router is defective. We bypassed it and the internet worked flawlessly for 24 hours. When reconnected the router dropped the internet within an hour and it will not maintain a connection. I tried flashing the router firmware which worked for another hour or so. If you buy this router be sure to purchase the square trade protection plan or you'll be stuck with a $150.00 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burt

customer_reviews.title: Version 1 no good
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this one. I bought this 3 months ago. I thought I was getting version 2 but Amazon sent version 1. There is a reason there is a version 2. Version 1 just doesn't work. It drops the signal about every 5 to 6 days and I have to reset it. There are no more firmware updates because Linksys probably has this version targeted as obsolete. I've dealt with a lot of routers over the years but have not seen this problem in a very long time. If you buy this router, make sure it is version 2 or send it back. I think version 2 has a lot of favorable reviews.
customer_reviews.author: M Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: So far great...
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this router. It seems to have good range (not amazing but good) and it covers all the current wireless protocols. The shape is a bit awkward but I am sure it will work fine for some people (on top of a desk, computer, etc). The web configuration page is nothing great although I do like the device view page which shows everything that is connected and has a IP address. I have had several other routers and this is far more stable then all of them. p.s. I just wish Linksys would release there bios source code for developers like they did for the WRT54g
customer_reviews.author: DJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Works well with dd-wrt
customer_reviews.text: The stock firmware (1.1.40) is not stable, lost signal many times. it has very basic features. Linksys may need think about just stop making their own firmware but using dd-wrt. After flashed dd-wrt, I got stable connection except 2.4G always running at 144Mbps. EA6500 has the best price for AC1750 router, Netgear and Asus are at $150-200 range. Even TP-Link C7 cost about $100. EA6500 has better hardware than C7, even C8, except the stock firmware is not good.
customer_reviews.author: rqi522

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY...
customer_reviews.text: This is a total waste of money and time. I was excited to get this router to replace my current Linksys G-Router. It came in a box, wrapped in saran wrap. No paperwork, no user guide, and now router access number. Without the access number you are unable to connect to router without a USB cable. I even had my brother-in-law, that is a computer engineer, who tried to connect router. He was unsuccessful. So after 3 days of arrival, I sent it back. Don't buy this product, is not worth the ink to print the return label.
customer_reviews.author: Koala

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product! This router crashes about ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product! This router crashes about once a day, drops connections on both ethernet and wifi until a hard reset is done. It also constantly slows down speeds to a crawl that can only be fixed by a hard reset. Linksys routers have been nothing but disappointments in recent years and I will DEFINITELY be looking towards another company for the replacement
customer_reviews.author: EY

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, or rather
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, or rather, following the instructions provided, and had my PC connected to the modem and was streaming at 60mbps within an hour. Plenty of options on the modem config web page. Love the ability to designate a visitors access, separate from my personal access point. I'll keep the 5MHz channel to myself, thank you very much. Didn't need the child protection features, but liked the extensive security options and pass-through for my own usage. Would recommend for anyone whom needs a simple setup dual-band wifi router that can operate on the slowly spreading broadband isp networks.
customer_reviews.author: John beard

customer_reviews.title: Great router and the AC technology is flawless for beta!
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough good things about this router. All 3 bands work great. Wireless G and N are flawless (after most recent firmware update), wireless AC is just screaming fast. All the bad reviews are from people that either do not update to the newest firmware or do not know how to effectively set up a router for their homes needs. I can honestly say I do not regret buying this. I have had it for over a year and it is still working well. The range could be better but in the house it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The Linksys AC1750 Wi-Fi Wireless Dual-Band Router BEST BEST BEST!
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys AC1750 Wi-Fi Wireless Dual-Band Router is hands down one of the best routers and wifi modems I have ever used. - EA6500 has mounting points on the bottom - good for HD video streaming - Can not be reconfigured as a range extender - Great Range + Quality + Signal
customer_reviews.author: Ramez

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a small network with limited distance and walls
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and configure. Using it an access point to existing non-Linksys network - working okay, but power (reach) is not very good. Antennas are internal only. Fits my immediate need, but will be replacing it soon. I have it placed in a room at the end of a 25 foot hallway. Signal cuts to about 60db at 40 feet. Documentation is pretty good, but as an access-point only, options are limiting.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Works Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My same linksy router broke recently and worked awesome for ten years! So I was lucky to still find it on amazon and I’m so glad they still have my exact same one available from years ago!!! I tried it and works perfect still! I bought it NEW ofcourse and highly recommended even though it’s an older model I have NO PROBLEMS AT ALL WITH IT! Fast speed even for my son that is a Alienware Gamer works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Wi-fi signal just too weak .. the reviews are accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Linksys E4200 that was several years old. That was a mistake. The old router had far, far better range. With the AC1750, there are rooms in my house where I have no signal, and that never happened before. Also, I never could get a USB drive attached to serve properly. Yes, firmware is up-to-date. And the router is in the exact same place as the old one. It's just quite simply not as good.
customer_reviews.author: PublicPersona

customer_reviews.title: Fast, strong and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: easy to setup and blazing fast wifi speeds. i'm receiving up to 165Mbps download and 35Mbps upload. signal strength is very strong in my single level 2500sf home. router is located in NW corner room and i have a strong signal from the SE corner of my home. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: apchelden

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Access Point!
customer_reviews.text: Wall mounted and setup this Router as an Access Point and Switch upstairs where the WiFi has really been spotty in my house (I ran an Ethernet cable from the modem in the basement up to the attic and down to where this is wall mounted). I'm now getting 180Mbps over WiFi to my laptop and everything works great in the bridged mode. The setup was easy, it updated Firmware automatically in the start and has worked great so far! I also wired the rest of my upstairs with Ethernet through the built in switch and those connections have also been very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: CSCO EA6500 Failure:
customer_reviews.text: Purchase date was 2/26/13. Been having download speed problems for several months now. Router identified as the problem by IT technician. Am tired of continually going through the power down and restart almost every day along with download speed stopping for several seconds then OK for the next minute or two. Guess CISCO knows how to make them work for the one year warranted period. Now shopping for a replacement and most likely will try a Netgear N900. I would guess that heat is the problem as it always gets pretty warm even after I set it up on a metal stand to get more air under and around it.
customer_reviews.author: felixpauls

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Router Works as Great Access Point
customer_reviews.text: I used this router in bridge mode as an access point when Time Warner Cable upped their speed to 300 Mbps. My previous AP had problems working with my iPad in passing network information and accessing my wireless printer in another room. The switch to the Linksys router/AP caused all of these problems to disappear completely. I can get the full TWC speed upgrade through the Linksys to my iPad too.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the worst purchase I have ever made. I should have listened to the majority of the reviews! Waited to get this and hook it up and I couldn't keep the connection with any of my devices. It kept repeatedly dropping the signal and wouldn't reconnect right away. I do not usually write these reviews but I felt I had to after the horrible experience i had with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Good, intuitive device control
customer_reviews.text: Works nice and includes a good, intuitive level of device control. It allows devices to be individually labelled with sensible names, like "Little Johnny's cell phone".
customer_reviews.author: David Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: EA6500 LYNKSYS ROUTER  POOR PERFORMANCE
customer_reviews.text: This is a poorly built router. It drops signal just about every minute. Amazon hid the bad reviews that talked about the problems I am experiencing else I would not have bought this router. Too late I cannot return it so am stuck with it until am able to afford a new decent router. My prior E2500 LYNKSYS Router cost a fraction of this one but was more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: LEBARONE

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls do NOT work
customer_reviews.text: Spent over 2 hours on phone with linksys support and could not get the parental controls to work properly. I am an IT professional and have installed much more complex devices. Would not recommend this. I bought the Asus Dual-Band Wireless-N600 Gigabit Router. The Asus was very easy to install and setup parental controls, but the range is not great.
customer_reviews.author: rb in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Dead at 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this device, unreliable from the start, finally died completely at 9 months. Never worked well with the Linksys Wireless-AC Universal Media Connector (WUMC710), constantly dropping connections. No amount of tuning or static IPs would fix the issue. I was able to fall back to our old WRT54GL. I redirected the WUMC710 to an Apple AirPort TimeMachine and that solved the dropped connection issue, turns out we didn't need the AC protocol at all. It appears I am not the only one to have had problems with this device. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: T. Kunau

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 of these and only 1 still works
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these routers to use in my 2 story house. I intended to use 1 of them in bridge mode as just an access point for upstairs. This worked fine for a while but all of the sudden the one that I set up as an access point crashed and now it won't accept any incoming connections. I can log into it just fine and it says that it is working as it should but it isn't. I have factory reset it and still nothing. The router that I have set to function as a router works just fine. It accepts incoming connections just like it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: Better than an Apple Airport Extreme!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding Router! works great, and works better than my Airport Extreme in every way. I have a slow connection speed and I tried using an apple router and I couldn't even stream audio, let alone video. With the Linksys, I could stream audio without it getting interrupted in mid song and the video the same way. With video I have to use my Xbox One and then I don't get any video interruptions, unlike with the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Very Unhappy with LINKSYS Right now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to make my streaming of video throughout my home a non-buffering issue. It worked great for a couple of weeks and then like other reviews it started dropping connections left and right. I checked for firmware upgrades and reset numerous times. But I got no relief from constant device droppage. I will now look at buying another make and model and throw this one right in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: EBC

customer_reviews.title: Buggy firmware
customer_reviews.text: from a setup perspective this router is good and the signal strength is excellent. The issue I have at the time of this writing is the buggy firmware. The DHCP client table shows multiple ip's for one device and with ip's actually assigned to other devices. However, this has not impacted any devices abilities to connect to the internet. Waiting for firmware update from cisco to see if issue is addressed. another note is that streaming music and video is very good
customer_reviews.author: G. Cacciatore

customer_reviews.title: Requires too much attention
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this router and while it was a relatively easy setup I've had to a few minor issues but I just realized that my youtube viewing problem is due somehow to this router. I switched to Windows 8 at the same time I got this router so I thought the issue was with my computer until this week when I used my laptop on another router and had absolutely no problems. I can't find any written support for this issue and its too late to send it back. I think we need a firmware update!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Today the router has finally died (eight months later) Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router in November 2013. It was not delivering the performance boost I had anticipated after initially installing it. It has been an intermittent problem ever since I installed it, however it was difficult to determine were the source of the problem was coming from. Today the router has finally died (eight months later) Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: RDMS

customer_reviews.title: A buggy, deeply flawed product
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy enough, but the guest network flat-out did not work. After reviewing many posts on the support website, it is clear that this is a common problem with no solution. I checked MTU size and did find one issue which I corrected, but it did not make a difference...I can see the router connect to the client, but none of the clients can get through to the internet. I downloaded the latest firmware, checked everything else that was suggested on the website and got nowhere. Tech support was no help. Dont buy this one. It just doesn't work. Mine is being returned
customer_reviews.author: CAPoiDog

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my home and home office
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my home and home office. I have a enough devices connected for a small army and have not had a single issue in a year of owning. Guest password is a bonus so I keep my main connection private.
customer_reviews.author: moonsafari

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this router!
customer_reviews.text: Great if you don't like connecting wirelessly to the Internet. I am extremely disappointed in this purchase and I have returned it to Amazon. Just Google "Linksys AC1750 dropping connection" and find out how widespread this issue is. I placed this in the same spot as my old N router and I even had my cable company confirm signal was perfect out of my modem. Stay away and use another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Video Guy

customer_reviews.title: bought used but working like new. never had any issue intermittent internet and ...
customer_reviews.text: bought used but working like new. never had any issue intermittent internet and wifi for the last 2 weeks. smart linksys apps works ok too. i can monitor the performance and status of my connected devices. can detect external usb storage right away. no waiting. easy to set up. bottom line i'm happy. however, i will monitor for the last 2 months and will give same 5 stars if i have no problems. i can recommend
customer_reviews.author: gee dhy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good access point. Not perfect, but much better than my old one. The Smart Wi-Fi is ok, not perfect either. Could use better parental control features. Instead you have to purchase those separately and then they are not very good. A good firmware update might resolve some of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: JimE2

customer_reviews.title: fast speeds and great functionality. Sometimes when I'm accessing my media server ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for about a year now and it's still going strong. Very rarely needs to be reset, fast speeds and great functionality. Sometimes when I'm accessing my media server remotely, it goes pretty slow, very choppily playing video for a good long while before it seems to find its footing. But overall I'm very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or your time on this one.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for 1 year and it is now completely inoperable. I bought this one as my old Linksys unit was old and slow. This one was just as bad. I have spent many many many hours over this past year trouble shooting connections. It CONSTANTLY drops internet and network connections. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY! I will NEVER buy another Linksys item again.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.in the middle east
customer_reviews.text: I change the rating from 1 star to a 3 star because I want to be fair with the company. I am oversea and I cannot get this unit to work and it could be because they use a difference Wi-Fi so I went back to my old Net Gear Router which I purchase in this country. When I get back to the USA in July I will test it then and then I will give you a review on the this router. Thank.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar J. Vado

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these units and they are horrible. SLows down internet connection and disconnects wireless devices. I exhanged thru amazon several times. Allwere the same-horrible performance. Firmware was updated to latest code. Since Cisco is trying to sell Linksys, one would think that they would try to fix these routers to work as advertised and maintain the dwindling loyal Linksys followers for the new owners. I have used linksys products for many years and have had many good routers from them. Didn't belive all the bad reviews out there...thought newbies not knowing what they were doing. They were right on target with this one....Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Linksys EA6500 Smart Wi-Fi Dual-Band AC Router with Gigabit and 2x USB (Personal Computers)
customer_reviews.text: Do not use this thing with a switch. This router only works if it thinks it's controlling the entire network. If something gets between it and your modem the IP addresses get all screwed up. Once you don't try to do anything special with it, it works great and fast. This router will work great if you just KISS: Keep it simple stupid.
customer_reviews.author: KIM HO TRONG

customer_reviews.title: Future-proof your home
customer_reviews.text: One thing to worry about, is heat. During the summer, the ambient temps and humidity will interfere with the unit and the failsafe protocols will force it to stop working. The lights will still be on, but there won't be any packets coming or going. A great device with a fantastic GUI. It won't get much easier than this!
customer_reviews.author: ProNewsPhotog

customer_reviews.title: the router is good. but make some noise when it works at ...
customer_reviews.text: the router is good. but make some noise when it works at heavy load. but the wireless speed is not so stable. somethimes it stalls to only 2Mbyteper sec at 5G Hz band which i am not sure it is because of the radio environment or my PC NIC issue. the admin page is not so powerful as tplink or other cheaper models. but the NAT, FW Port forwarding function are quite powerful which i like. But nearly all status printout can only be printed out through the troubleshoot report.... which is ok to me. but overall it is a good WRT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a Cisco/Linksys Fan
customer_reviews.text: Linksys and Cisco used to be the best. However, this router is BY FAR the worst i have ever purchased. The first over heated and died within 7 days. The second has had overheating problems since day 14. I honestly have lived in fear of my router going down every day that I work from my home office. Sad to see such a great company deliver such a terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Andre P

customer_reviews.title: Much easier to install than anticipated. I was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to install than anticipated. I was looking to get more useable out of a DSL line to home wifi and it seems to have done that although not a whole lot more. I think the biggest obstacle is unavailability of ac enable attached devices...unless u get newer models , maybe refurbed..new costs more thugh right?
customer_reviews.author: Les Ismore

customer_reviews.title: Would refer it
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to hook up even though the cord didn't work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent connection; too slow transfer speeds.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Linksys EA6500 router to replace my Linksys WRT400N router (which worked great for years, but started failing). The new router looks sleek and the ports on the back offer a lot of options (4 ports, USB capable) and I liked the app install functions. However, I noticed write away the difference in response times and constant loading delays. Previously swift page displays on the old WRT400N (a couple of seconds) now display the twirling ring of wait for minutes at times. I use my connection for my home office (cable modem connected) and cannot afford all of these waits in my display. I will be returning this router and replacing it with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson A. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, good price
customer_reviews.text: I've had the opportunity to use this router for several months now. It has performed flawlessly. I've had other brand routers, but my favorites have been Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: StephenH

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about spending so much money on a router when I could get one for much less, however I am happy I got this one. It provides great wireless coverage, is fast and has a very easy to use interface. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill and Crissy

customer_reviews.title: I tried an extender and still could not get a good connection. I also installed a new modem from ...
customer_reviews.text: This router would not reach my studio upstairs. I tried an extender and still could not get a good connection. I also installed a new modem from TWC and still no success. It would connect and 2 -3 minutes later the buffering did not stop until I got a notice that I was not connected. I bought a Netgear and it works without any problems. My signal strength is -25, with the Linksys it was between -75 and -65 standing next to the router. Now Amazon say's I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tatertot

customer_reviews.title: ... this for a year and at first it was good but within the last few months I find I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a year and at first it was good but within the last few months I find I am having to reboot it alot. I would recommend buying a different router. My previous router I never rebooted I was just looking for a stronger one when I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: texas gal

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the EA4500
customer_reviews.text: Item is not as great as I had expected I have to restart this by unplugging it and plugging it back in again, It has given me a lot of headaches since I upgraded it, went back to my EA4500 which is still dependable as ever, Linksys should find out why this is always dropping the link to the web
customer_reviews.author: Nitehawke3

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to install or actually use at all!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this item, hooked it up and....nothing. Called the number for assistance and an hour later got it working....somewhat. She gave me 2 networks, one for distance and one for speed. I have a very small house and whenever we take the laptop anywhere, we have to change the network. The connection is constantIy dropping and to top it off the tech support tried to sell me an extended warranty for $30!!! Who does that????????? am so frustrated and the thought of being on the phone for an hour again, for a new product, drives me mad!!!
customer_reviews.author: ALD

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an EA6500 and WUMC710 at the same time. These worked perfectly together for many months. Impressive performance. At some point this changed. These days the two disconnect daily. Power cycling the WUMC710 always brings it back operational for another day, but this certainly gets old. If you want something reliable I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Gillie

customer_reviews.title: This router is much more superior than the previous router I had "dr-665" I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: This router is much more superior than the previous router I had "dr-665" I bought it because I had DNS problems on my previous router due to alot devices connected (avg. 16 connection) all the time. so I bought this and was not disappointed definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Alketbi

customer_reviews.title: Hello. buy a modem a year ago but I ...
customer_reviews.text: Hello . buy a modem a year ago but I is coming today 9/15/14 after many problems with the carrier. At that time buy several things in different places but today I check and the modem can not reach. Understand what happened a long time but if I can give some kind of information I thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JC BULLS

customer_reviews.title: Not a stong WIFI router
customer_reviews.text: Wifi Range is not good and strong compared my old Asus (non AC) router. Do not have the log running all the time and really do not know what is the issue when it drops connection, Using it as a Switch and it is performing OK for wired connections. This may work better for a small house and if you are looking it for a bigger space and multiple floors, buy something that has good range.
customer_reviews.author: tkvlvk

customer_reviews.title: Best Performance Router I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: Installed this for my Mother-in_Law and she has not experienced any problems or drops since installed months ago. So glad as tech issues can be a real annoyance for an 89-year old.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: This router is great! It works very good with my sever and ...
customer_reviews.text: This router is great! It works very good with my sever and provides good coverage in my home. Although, at times my phone does not have very strong connection and calls do not come in as they should
customer_reviews.author: Janice Y. Sinna

customer_reviews.title: This wifi router does a decent job and putting off ...
customer_reviews.text: This wifi router does a decent job and putting off a signal. It doesnt reach all the upstairs room at times and the signal gets a little weak, but that is not a deal breaker for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works great as long as you are standing next to it.
customer_reviews.text: Reception on 2.4 and 5 GHZ bands is horrible. If I walk out of the room the device is located in, the 5GHZ drops and disconnects. The 2.4 band is at half strength. My old Linksys did a better job than this.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: Using DMZ mode or any type of port forwarding causes the router to lose internet connectivity. Also have a bug where multiple MAC addresses - and associated IP - are listed under the same device. This is problematic if using parental controls to restrict access. Also getting false MAC info as LAN connected devices. Have the current firmware and reset to factory standards multiple times, but something always seems to crop up over the few weeks I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond L. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: We are just about to email for a replacement because ...
customer_reviews.text: We are just about to email for a replacement because ours went out. While it has a 5GHZ speed, the range is limited and cant reach to the upstairs rooms. So its pointless. And therefore slower than our other router.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: JUNK, burned out within a year
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a new one, and the only vendor that has there act together. So what can you do, but buy another and rate the old one. First one ever to do so, and this my first one by now means.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Leclair

customer_reviews.title: Run away and DO NOT buy this
customer_reviews.text: I'll never buy a linksys router again I hate this router. I bought it about a month ago. - The E4200v2 is waaaay better (this was supposed to be an upgrade) - I have to reset it constantly - The lowest wifi range ever (the same as a $20 tp-link) - Device list gets all messed up when working with a repeater. - QoS is useless
customer_reviews.author: Oswaldo S.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this router!!!! It does everything and more. Some products tell you things about what their products can do, but don't live up to the hype. This company has it all together!! A great product and simple set up. The set up was so simple that even a baby could do it. That deserves a WOW!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harris

customer_reviews.title: good speed, bad range
customer_reviews.text: the router was fast when i used a LAN connection, but the wifi had horrible range, i mean like not even 15 feet. my product might have been defective though. but on the other hand i got a ea6500 v1, not a v2, so that might have something to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyButtcrack

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC1750 Wi-Fi Wireless Dual-Band+ Router
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I have ordered. Obviously it's an excellent product having purchased two.
customer_reviews.author: GregT

customer_reviews.title: The worse tech in my home.
customer_reviews.text: The first month it worked flawlessly. Now, two months in, it is the worse tech in my home. It would reboot itself every 5 seconds checking for updates, constant signal drop, and on top of that Linksys tech support knows nothing unless the read it from a manual. At one point I had to make them understand how routers work. Also, make sure the item you buy is new. When I order mine it stated it was new; however, that was a lie. When I check with a link, this system had been in used since 2014, and the warranty expired.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: works great now.
customer_reviews.text: delivered quick...works great now..little of a pain in the butt to set up. However its much faster than my wireless G router.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Trouble from Day 1
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product with hopes of enhanced wireless connectivity. I did achieve that. However, I regularly lose internet connection with this router and have to call Linksys Customer Service. Customer service is only free for 90 days, then you have to pay to get them to help you. My expectations for this router have not been met and I do not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon15951

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Constantly looses internet even after Linksys replaced it with another. My old model of Linksys works better then this one. Even bought a repeater but it stops connecting even in the room it's located in.
customer_reviews.author: PHA

customer_reviews.title: I replaced a DLink300 g modem with this ac modem ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a DLink300 g modem with this ac modem. The 2.4 Ghz band on n is about 50% greater but my old i Modem had a non-standard16 db antenna on it. The range on 2.4 ghz is about the same. The 5.0 ghz ac band is about 50% faster again only wife's iPhone5 but range is less. I was expecting a bigger boost in performance. Installation took a while because my ISP uses a static IP address.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Blaikie

customer_reviews.title: Well pleased
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and much faster than my old N router. Also, my internet doesn't keep dropping like it used to. It seemed like I was daily having to unplug my router to reconnect, but not with this new router.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Sexton

customer_reviews.title: so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: i've had it for a week, and so far it's great! Relatively easy set up... didn't like setting up from phone. had to sit at connected PC. will update as time passes if necessary
customer_reviews.author: K. Miracle

customer_reviews.title: Love the router.
customer_reviews.text: We are Linksys fans and this router did not disappoint. Wireless reach is better than the old one. I like the fact that I can manually configure the router and not be forced into using the wizard.
customer_reviews.author: J-Bird

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router on 2/19 and it quit working on 3/23 (about 5 weeks). Initially, I spent considerable time with Linksys support getting it set up properly. I reordered a second router and placed it in service on 3/26. That unit worked 2 weeks before it died. I have always purchased Linksys products for many years and have never seen anything like this. Unfortunately, I believe that they have a component that is failing causing these to stop working. I will say that when it worked, the wireless signal was very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I would be happier if it actually performed right out of the box like it is advertised however after the update it is performing much better.
customer_reviews.author: Diann

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Did not work any better than my old supposedly slower router. The company took it back but I had to pay the shipping.
customer_reviews.author: bklynbob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: HJave had this product for a few years. works great
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Faster With Better Range
customer_reviews.text: I needed more coverage and this router made it possible. Now get faster WiFi throughout the house. Also like that there is a guest network built into this router. Friends can access the internet but not my stuff
customer_reviews.author: Dailyrider

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I think this router unfairly had a bad reputation. Albeit - I do not have a complex/advanced setup. I purchased primarily to hook up to USB3 hard drive to serve files through network share. For this function it couldn't be easier. I've streamed video to three computers (through the network share) at once with no lag. Very easy setup. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Collette

customer_reviews.title: I have had it working for a couple of weeks ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had it working for a couple of weeks now. Everything is running faster than is did with my Linksys E2500. I have ten devices running through the AC1750 and more coming. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: riosmith

customer_reviews.title: Nice and cost effective router
customer_reviews.text: Nice and cost effective router. Coverage is ok for an Small office/Home office. 5G support is a nice feature. AC compatible, elegant design.
customer_reviews.author: NELSON R.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great. Only issue is that I have to do a hard reset every few days to have it work to its optimal speed. I verified that the issue was in fact with router by hard connecting with modem.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Good router, some set-up issues
customer_reviews.text: Received the router, excellent (new) condition. On set-up they have you using a 'wizard' that assumes user knows little about the hardware and configuration, they present no CLI for advanced users although the web interface allows manual setup. The WPS has never worked for me on any Linksys product, and did not work this time between the EA6500 and UMC710 (both current Linksys products!!) or any other WPS-enabled device. I prefer MAC filtering anyway, but was hoping to see the WPS work at least between Linksys devices. The WLAN range is good, performance is excellent, streaming video from broadband connection in den to WDTV device in family room on another floor works very well. All i-devices and laptops connect well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Fasy

customer_reviews.title: Lots of nice features.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the Linksys router. It improved the performance of my wireless network, provided a guest network, and I particularly like that it supports a network drive. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: HDL Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Super fast!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast speeds from my laptop so far (4 weeks so far). I'm pulling 3 times the speed I'm paying for by using the 5ghz channel. I love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: BassJE

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy wifi router
customer_reviews.text: Great wifi router, extends range and increases my network speeds considerably throughout my home. Very easy to setup and manage
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers out there.
customer_reviews.text: Fast simple to set up dual band wireless router. Very good.
customer_reviews.author: mfg275

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, terrific performance.
customer_reviews.text: Router was delivered on time and in perfect condition. The AC1750 was very easy to setup and provides great function and superior performance. A really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Howardlew

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: very hard to install . spent hours trying to sync with devices . lost signal 10 ft away cant wait to return . rather not talk to someone in inda about the problem
customer_reviews.author: MARC

product_meta.title: Linksys AC1750 Wi-Fi Wireless Dual-Band+ Router with Gigabit, Smart Wi-Fi App Enabled to Control Your Network from Anywhere (EA6500)
product_meta.description: Use this Dual-Band Wireless Router to access and optimize your network from anywhere through a mobile app or browser. Latest draft 802.11ac wireless technology delivers ultimate speeds of up to N450 plus AC1300 Mbps. Dual-band N (2.4 and 5 GHz) helps avoid interference and maximize throughput for smoother HD video streaming, file transfers, and wireless gaming. High-power amplifiers help achieve ultimate range, increasing HD video and media streaming coverage area. Higher quality antenna technology helps to maintain high speeds across greater distances for maximum wireless coverage. 3D antenna array allows wall-mounted or tabletop display. Two USB ports allow you to simultaneously share printers and storage. Simple Tap technology lets you add Wi-Fi and NFC-enabled devices to your network. IPv6-enabled router is backward-compatible with a/b/g/n devices. Help keep your network and personal information protected with advanced WPA2 encryption and integrated firewall.
feature_bullets: Simultaneous dual-band speed up to N450 Mbps (2.4 GHz) + AC1300 Mbps (5 GHz) for media-intense applications
Access and optimize your home network from anywhere through a mobile app or browser
SimpleTap Technology to add Wi-Fi and NFC-enabled devices to your network
Advanced Beamforming technology improves Wi-Fi reception by focusing the Wi-Fi signal to a select device within home environments that suffer from signal interference
Port USB1 serves as USB 3.0 which provides 10x faster file transfer speeds than USB 2.0
A growing suite of Smart Wi-Fi apps offer improved opportunities to control one?s home network
Easy setup: Simple installation requires no CD

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,016 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
